definition: King Wen of Zhou state (c. 1152-1056 BC), reigned c. 1099-1056 BC as king of Zhou state, leading figure in building the subsequent Western Zhou dynasty, father of King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] the first Zhou dynasty king
surname Zhou/Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially
week/weekly/variant of 周[zhou1]
language/culture/writing/formal/literary/gentle/(old) classifier for coins/Kangxi radical 67
surname Wen
surname Wang
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
to rule/to reign over

sentences.english: Mencius told him the story of King Wenwang of Zhou.
sentences.chinese: 孟子就讲了周文王的故事。

sentences.english: King Wen of the Zhou Dynasty. You've never heard of him?
sentences.chinese: 周文王啊。你没有听说过吗？

sentences.english: King Wen of the Zhou Dynasty was a strong-willed man.
sentences.chinese: 周文王真是个意志坚强的人。

definition: King Wu of Zhou (-1043), personal name Ji Fa 姬發|姬发, reigned 1046-1043 BC as first king of Western Zhou dynasty 1046-1043 BC
see Jiang Ziya 姜子牙[Jiang1 Zi3 ya2]
King Wu of Zhou, personal name Ji Fa, reigned 1046-1043 BC as first king of Western Zhou dynasty 西周[Xi1 Zhou1] 1046-771 BC
King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] overthrows tyrant Zhou of Shang 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2]
King Zhou of Shang (11th century BC), notorious as a cruel tyrant
Jizi, legendary sage from end of Shang dynasty (c. 1100 BC), said to have opposed the tyrant Zhòu 紂|纣 then ruled ancient Korea for Zhōu 周
King Cheng of Zhou (1055-1021 BC), reigned 1042-1021 BC as the 2nd king of Western Zhou 西周[Xi1 Zhou1], son of King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2]
Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)
Zhou Dynasty/Western Zhou 西周 (1046-771 BC) and Eastern Zhou 東周|东周 (770-221 BC)
Di Ku or Emperor Ku, one of the Five Legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], great-grandson of the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4]
final name of the Shang dynasty after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
King Xuan, eleventh King of Zhou, reigned (828-782 BC)
the Zhou dynasty from 1027 BC
Western Zhou (1027-771 BC)
Fuxi or Fu Hsi, legendary Chinese emperor 2852-2738 BC, mythical creator of fishing, trapping, and writing
Di Yi (died 1076 BC), Shang dynasty king, reigned 1101-1076 BC
